selection

dmNational_formula.Rd

this is the shared decision making national formula function

dmNational_formula(
  recip_matrix,
  donor_matrix = sim_donor_matrix[d, ],
  allocation_score = recip_score,
  HLA = HLA_matrix,
  graft_number = num_kidney_national,
  parameter_a = 1,
  parameter_b = 1,
  parameter_c = 1,
  quality = TRUE,
  age = TRUE,
  state = TRUE,
  bloodgroup = TRUE,
  accept_prob = NULL,
  yearly_scale = rep(1, 100)
)

Arguments

recip_matrix

this is the input recipient matrix
donor_matrix

this is the input donor matrix
allocation_score

this is the score for each pair
HLA

this is the calculated HLA mismatching counts matrix
graft_number

this is the graft number
parameter_a

hyperparameter to tune
parameter_b

hyperparameter to tune
parameter_c

hyperparameter to tune
quality

quality measure indicator
age

age indicator
state

state indicator
bloodgroup

blood group indicator
accept_prob

acceptence probability
yearly_scale

yearly scale

Value

matched recipient

Examples

data("newdata", package = "KidneyAllocation")
HLA_matrix <- HLAmatchCalMat(raw_recip_matrix_subset, raw_donor_matrix[1,])

selected <- dmNational_formula(raw_recip_matrix_subset,raw_donor_matrix[1,],
allocation_score=allocation_national(raw_recip_matrix_subset,raw_donor_matrix[1,],HLA_matrix),
HLA_matrix,1,1,1,1,TRUE,TRUE,TRUE,TRUE,accept_prob = NULL, yearly_scale=rep(1, 100));

#> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf
#> [1] "days"
#> [1] "year"
#> [1] "yearly_scale"
#> [1] "p_Accept"
